headline: Meatball Sandwich
description: Meatballs in tomato sauce with melted cheese on a lightly toasted baguette.

video.description: See how to make a 5-star meatball sandwich.
video.name: Meatball Sandwich

name: Meatball Sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, garlic, Parmesan cheese, parsley, and Italian seasoning in a large bowl. Mix with your hands until well combined. Shape mixture into 12 meatballs, and place in a baking dish.
Bake meatballs in the preheated oven until cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).
While the meatballs are cooking, cut baguette in half lengthwise and open like a book. Remove and discard some of the bread from the inside to make a well for the meatballs.
Brush baguette with olive oil and season with garlic powder and salt. Place baguette on a baking tray, open and with the oiled sides facing up.
When the meatballs have 5 minutes left, slip the baguette into the oven and cook until lightly toasted.
Meanwhile, warm spaghetti sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
Remove meatballs from the oven. Use a slotted spoon to transfer them to the hot sauce; mix gently to coat with sauce.
Spoon meatballs and sauce into one side of the baguette, nestling meatballs in the well. Top with slices of provolone cheese.
Return to the oven until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
Cool slightly, then cut into 4 sandwiches.

review.reviewBody: The only thing I did differently was placed the cheese directly on the bread as a barrier so that sauce doesn't soften the bread too much!
Super easy recipe that produces maybe the best meatball sub I’ve ever eaten.

Wow, very tasty. I used cheese-baked hoagie rolls but still prepared them the same way with with oil and garlic salt. I also backed off on the amount of breadcrumbs and used 3/8 of a cup panko (1/4 cup + 1/8 cup). Will definitely make again.

My husband gets meatball subs at Subway and couldn’t believe how much better these were. The only change I made from this recipe was using shredded mozzarella. I also used Jimmy John’s day old bread. You can’t beat it at $.50 a loaf.
By far the best meatball recipe I have ever had. I substituted the ground beef with ground turkey!! Delish!!!

This recipe is a good foundation. The meatballs came out great. I purchased and used long rolls. I used a can of tomato puree and a can of crushed tomatoes instead of the processed sauce. I spiced up my sauce. If you use your imagination, you can make this recipe your own. Very easy to make. One other tip. I used disposable gloves when I mixed the hamburger and other ingredients. Easy peesy.
Very good
All I can say is the end was really delicious and tasty
Very good meatball subs. The meatballs are seasoned perfectly in this recipe with a lot of flavor.
Easy and quick really good!! Hack I could sell them!!!

Delicious recipe. One great alteration: Use Italian bread crumbs that you can buy instead of regular, then omit the Italian seasoning. Also I’ve seen some say they made 24 meatballs instead of 12. If that’s the case, I’ll just go ahead and say it. Your balls are too small.
Wife said that it was delicious.
Delicious! Would definitely make again!

I highly recommend using the meatball part of this recipe from "Chef John's Meatballs" recipe here on Allrecipes. His are (mostly) just as easy, and is a notably more flavorful meatball, works really well with the rest of this recipe. The most critical components in a meatball sub is in order: *the meatball*, the bread (should be crusty/chewy on the outside and soft on the inside), then the sauce, then cheese.
Myv12 yr old made these tonight. Substituted beef for turkey and provolone for gouda. Will need to work on the sauce a bit next time, but the meatballs were great!
Easy! Great tasting! I'm not even a meatball fan, but these were tasty and I will definitely keep them in my meal rotation either for sandwiches or to change up our spaghetti. Thanks!
Very tasty! Next time I will cook the meatballs in the sauce

I add one step after shaping the meatballs. I sear the meatballs in 3tbsp of Olive oil. Seals the flavors into meat.
Otherwise, excellent latenite meal.
By far the best meatball ever!! No changes necessary. Will definitely make it again. Family said they were better than any restaurant.

It was a hit! Next time I will use more sauce for the end sandwich. 
Made extra and used the rest to make burgers the next day with sautéed onions and mushrooms, and provolone it was fantastic!

This was a pretty good recipe. However, I only had Italian bread crumbs in my pantry. So, I reduced the Italian seasoning to 1.5 T instead of 2. I felt like the seasoning was a little too strong. But, my boyfriend liked it just fine. He said they were really good. I will make this again, but will be more careful about the spices. Excellent and simple recipe!
Easy recipe to follow. Great for a quick dinner. Made exactly as the recipe calls and it was excellent. Family enjoyed it.
I used ciabatta bread instead. Came out delicious!
I altered it a little I like using 50/50 ground pork and ground chuck 80/20 and instead of bread crumbs I used teaxs toast croutons smashed up and I add aged parmesan and hint of chili powder
This was wonderful!! It’s a definite keeper for my family!!

Hubby & kids loved it. I also tweaked it after reading reviews. I used Italian Bread Crumbs & omitted the Italian seasonings. I too added 4 tablespoons of parmesan cheese. However, I stuffed 1/2" string cheese cubes inside my meatballs. 350 for 20 mins was not enough time so after 20 mins (still raw) I increased the heat to 375 uncovered for an additional 15 minutes. But, it was a hit!
I didn't have a baguette, only hoagie buns but followed directions exactly and it was delicious!

The whole family loved these meatball grinders! I did increase the seasoning as suggested (plus salt and pepper!) as well as added more parmesan and used thin sliced gouda cheese instead of provolone. Meatballs were so delicious I am sure I'll be using the recipe for other meatball style dinners!

Lightly toasted garlic bread makes big difference. I also added a bit of sweet Italian sausage. When warming sauce and meatballs in electric covered skillet the meatballs become very tender. Very good and meatballs freeze easily.

4.5 stars. I don't like meatballs with so much bread crumbs, so I only added 2 T. And increased the spices by adding onion and garlic powders, red pepper flakes, basil, oregano and some Worcestershire sauce. Served on individual hoagie buns with mozzarella instead of provolone. If you put the sandwiches under the broiler to melt the cheese, be mindful that it takes less than a minute to burn the buns. Don't ask me how I know this. ;-)
Very good
Fantastic taste. The meatball seasoning was perfect.
Our family only makes the meatballs when serving pasta. Meatballs made as described. Always turn out flavourful and moist.
I used hot Italian sausage. Added a couple of cloves of roasted garlic. It was absolutely delicious!
My kids absolutely love this recipe!
I made this on the fly for something different for dinner. I didn't expect the rave reviews from the whole family! Everyone went back for seconds. Deffenitly putting a star next to this one.
Love this recipe! These meatball subs were great.. I didn't really add nor take anything away but I did add the ingredients to my taste liking. No measuring anything.. Will attempt again!
loved it
Used 2 eggs and marinara sause. Also added a dose of red pepper flakes
I would make it again
It was so good. Definitely, will make it again. My family loved it. Thanks!

Great meatballs! Wasn’t a fan of the sauce and I will use my own in the future. The meatballs were also made a tad bit too big so an open face meatball sandwich was required. I will be making future meatballs with an inch diameter so it would be easier to eat as well.
I thought it needed more seasoning then what the recipe recommended.

I LOVE IT MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
tyty
Fantastic meatball sandwich. Could not rave enough about it. Feel free to experiment with the seasonings. Each time you'll find a great result.
This has become a family favorite! Easy to prepare when you want a quick meal! This is my 13 year old son’s most requested dish.
I used dried parsley instead of fresh. These meatballs were so tasty. I will definitely make it again
I didn't make any changes, this was pretty good all by itself. I must say the first night I cooked it it was not as good as each day of leftovers. They were awesome.
I love it. I will make it again

I added one pound pork sausage in addition to the ground beef and then doubled the other ingredients to make 24 meatballs. The pork really added another layer of flavor. I also baked them on a rack (sprayed with olive oil nonstick cooking spray) over a cookie sheet, which drained the grease, and then I blotted them on paper towels when done. I researched several other recipes and found this to be the simplest, and in the end, absolutely fantastic!
I actually just made the meatballs bc that's all that I wanted. Frechbread is hard for me to chew.
Fantastic meal!! Highly recommend.
It turned out really good and I have never made or had a meatball sub before. Although I did tweak the recipe to fit the way that I normally make meatballs.
These have become a hit at my house.

Overall it was good. I thought the meatballs were a little bland. I even followed others suggestions bumping up seasonings, eggs,onion & cheese. I even added a jalapeño. I will make this again , with a little more tweeking. The 15 meatballs I made cooked perfectly in my toaster oven in 25 min.
Meatballs are very tender and flavorful.

I’m always looking for quick and delicious recipes during the week days. This meatball sandwich meets these criterias! It was so good. My husband asked when I was going to make this recipe again! The only thing I changed was the cheese. We don’t care for provolone, we used mozzarella instead.

I will say that I just started cooking recently and this was an easy recipe to make. My wife is an excellent cook and I knew if I won her over, this would be a success. Well, she gave it two thumbs up and most importantly our kids enjoyed it as well (kids can be so picky) so to win them over as well, I felt great! Follow the recipe to a tee and you two will feel great and fulfilled!

The best meatball sandwich we have ever eaten. Instead of bread crumbs I use pieces of Italian bread soaked in milk. I have tried several sauces and find we like Paul Newman's Marinara best. When the meatballs are done I simmer them in the sauce for about 30 minutes then store over night in the fridge just because I think most dishes taste better then next day. Makes for an easy make ahead meal Thanks for sharing this keeper recipe.
Very yummy and easy to make.

Substitute a little italian sausage for some of the ground beef. Added minced onion and extra parmesan cheese. Just two of us so half was made into meatballs the other half I cooked in frying pan and will use in lasagna. It actually works ! BTW- I wish reviewers would say why they didn't like this recipe, not just "didn't like".
I followed the alterations of other reviewers and I LOVE this recipe! I've used it several times, make meatballs in bulk, and freeze any that aren't eaten. Such an easy meal!

Amazing! I didn’t have Italian seasoning so I subbed dried parsley, oregano and basil. They were perfectly cooked at 20 minutes. I didn’t bother toasting the bread with olive oil, garlic or salt. Will make again and again :)
wow!! delicious
love this recipe. quick to make and feeds my whole family.

My husband and I loved it with ground bison. I followed a reviewer’s changes by adding an extra clove of garlic, an extra tbsp of grated parmesan cheese, 2 eggs, and 1 tsp fresh black pepper. Next time I will only toast the bread when I add the provolone cheese on top. I rolled the meatballs into bite size so 35 came out.
Used ground turkey and substituted Muenster cheese for provolone cheese
Family favorite now !!!

My kids (who are super picky eaters) love this recipe! The only item I modified was the garlic-- I used about 3/4 of a teaspoon minced garlic. Other than that, these are super easy to make and cook pretty quick as well.
These totally hit the spot. A really great meatball sub.

Made mostly to specs--per other suggestions, used a little more bread crumbs/Parmesan + 2 eggs, a little less parsley b/c that's all I had--and this came out great. Been trying (unsuccessfully) for years to make a good meataball sangwich--glad I finally have a winner. Thanks, all!

These were great. The whole family loved them. Had meatball sandwiches the first night and spaghetti and meatballs the second night. I used 1 Tbls. of Italian seasoning . This is going in my arsenal of favorite recipes. Yummy!
delicious!
Think it was great. Used some of the recommendations to up the salt and pepper to 2 TSP and increased the Italian seasoning to 1 T. Delicious! Also forgot the parsley and didn’t miss it.

I have made these a few times and LOVED them. The first time I did as the direction said and used the ingredients but after that I added a few other ingredients such as lemon pepper, chili powder, and onion powder. I also browned all the sides first before putting it in the oven to cook and it turns out great. This is my go to meatball sub and meatballs for other recipes.
So easy and delicious!

OK cheated just a little. Meatballs came from Costco and I use subs from the Deli at Kroger's . Followed the recipe on how to assemble adding the same spices and EEOV. Instead of topping with the other half of the bread I browned them, assembled with three meat balls per half and top with the Provolone cheese. Then back into the oven to melt . Couldn't just stop with one half and downed both. Excellent.
Made this with the only exception I made my own marinara sauce. It was very good and like to use these meatballs for spaghetti dinners as well

The whole family enjoyed this one. Double batch added 5 garlic cloves and a 3 eggs. Sprinkled fresh basil on top and used mozzarella because it was what I had. Made the meatballs in 1 Tbsp size with a flat edge so they baked quickly and didn't roll off the bread. Made about 50 meatballs but only used about half of them on 3 1/2 14" loaves. Happy to have leftovers!

So good even my husband who doesn't care for meatballs loved these. I doubled the recipe making 24 giant balls. Changes i made for doubled recipe 4 eggs, used italian seasoned crumbs, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1 tsp salt, 1 1/2 tsp pepper. I also used 45 oz sauce and browned them quickly with no oil then let them simmer covered on very low heat setting in the sauce for about an hour instead of baking. I used hoagie rolls and didnt do the extra steps for them. These were wonderful. Thank you for sharing your recipe

Less bread crumbs
Add tomato sauce
No changes required.
Enjoyed by parents and kids. Don't over-toast the bread and add some spices to the sauce; what's good for spaghetti was a bit bland for the bread.

I made it exactly as the recipe said (for the exception of my sandwich...i don't like cheese). I think the only issue i had (personal issue) was that the meat balls weren't salty enough for me (i LOVE salt...bad i know) which was an easy fix BUT the husband and teen LOVED them, even the man-child 1 year old loved it, so i will definitely be making again.
Trained out great, kids and hubby loved it. Will definitely make more often. This is a good, quick meal for working parents.
We use mozzarella instead of provolone. This is one of our favorite things to make!

10.08.16 ~ Whipped up this quick meatball recipe to have a couple for dinner in mini slider buns and to have a few in the freezer for a quick meal. These worked perfectly with nice flavor. I had an open package of sharp cheddar cheese, so I used that rather than provolone. Served this with 'Kicked Up Mac and Cheese' from AR.

I was looking for a meatball recipe and came across this. The only changes I made was that I didn't have fresh parsley so I used dried and I don't buy Parmesan in a can so it was freshly grated. I also used mozzarella cheese. To make it easier for the kids with keeping it on the bun, I baked in a cupcake pan and smushed it somewhat flat. Was a very delicious recipe. Of course, the sauce you use will determine how this would taste as well. I was very happy and would make again.
New favorite!

I made this for my girlfriend the other day. I skipped the parsley and used mozz cheese rather than prov, but it still came out great. we made them into grinders. she loved it and even had a few extra meatballs after. it was a total success! she now prefers this recipe over the pizza shop down the street. love it!

Very yummy! Per another's review I made this with 2 eggs instead of 1 and 3 tsp Italian seasoning instead of two. I thought the seasoning was a bit strong, and would probably stick to 2 tsp next time, though.

Really good. I made it with 1/2 lb ground beef and 1/2 lb ground Italian sausage, 2 eggs and omitted the Italian Seasoning since I thought the sausage was seasoned enough. I also browned them a bit before baking. Nice and moist. A keeper.
Delicious! I used garlic salt in the meatballs and took out the garlic powder & salt. I also doubled the Italian seasoning. It could've used more sauce because it made A LOT of meatballs.
Super easy and a family pleaser - all of us love it!! Meatball Mondays - our new favorite!
We loved these meatball subs, will also use the meatball recipe when I make spaghetti.
We loved these meatball subs, will also use the meatball recipe when I make spaghetti.
This is one of our family's favorites thank you

This is without a doubt my new go to meatballs! Never had made homemade meatballs before and couldn't believe how easy it was. Followed recipe exactly and they were really good! Toasting the bread was key! Thanks for the recipe!
I have made this several times and my whole family loves it. They always harass me to make it whenever I can.
